definitions.definition: The light from the Sun, as opposed to that from any other source.
A light source that simulates daylight.
(photometry) The intensity distribution of light over the visible spectrum generated by the Sun under various conditions or by other light sources intended to simulate natural daylight.
The period of time between sunrise and sunset.
definitions.example: We should get home while it's still daylight.

definitions.definition: Daybreak.
definitions.example: We had only two hours to work before daylight.

definitions.definition: Exposure to public scrutiny.
definitions.example: Budgeting a spy organization can't very well be done in daylight.

definitions.definition: A clear, open space.
definitions.example: All small running backs instinctively run to daylight.

definitions.definition: (machinery) The space between platens on a press or similar machinery.
definitions.example: The minimum and maximum daylights on an injection molding machine determines the sizes of the items it can make.

definitions.definition: Emotional or psychological distance between people, or disagreement.
definitions.example: We completely agree. There's no daylight between us on the issue.

definitions.definition: To expose to daylight
To provide sources of natural illumination such as skylights or windows.
To allow light in, as by opening drapes.
(landscaping) To run a drainage pipe to an opening from which its contents can drain away naturally.
To gain exposure to the open.
definitions.example: The seam of coal daylighted at a cliff by the river.

definitions.definition: The part of a stage that is farthest from the audience or camera.
To draw attention away from others, especially on-stage.
definitions.example: She only wore that dress to upstage everyone.

definitions.definition: To force other actors to face away from the audience by staying upstage.
To treat snobbishly.
To restage (cancer) to a higher stage than that found at last assessment (compare downstage).
At the rear of a stage.
definitions.example: The minimalist play used no upstage scenery.

definitions.definition: Toward or at the rear of a theatrical stage.
definitions.example: The actor turned and walked upstage.

definitions.definition: Away from a motion-picture or television camera.
A staircase or ladder from one deck to another on a ship
A melon of species Cucumis melo subsp. melo with sweet orange flesh, with numerous cultivars in several cultivar groups.
An orange colour, like that of cantaloupe flesh.
A woman in charge of the procurement, maintenance, and inventory of the costumes and other clothing worn by performers.
An acute myocardial infarction, sometimes fatal, caused by the sudden occurrence of coronary thrombosis, which obstructs the blood supply to the heart and leads to necrosis of heart muscle tissue.
Death or failure.
definitions.example: My computer had a heart attack when I tried to get it to run that program.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the world of entertainment) A great success; a hit.
Outstanding; very good or successful.
Any of several perennial plants, of the genus Hemerocallis, that have fleshy roots, grasslike leaves and colourful flowers that bloom for just one day.
To bring back into alignment.
To align again or anew.
A person, usually a woman, who wears a hijab.
The practice, among Muslim women, of covering the body after the age of puberty in front of non-related adult males.
A traditional headscarf worn by Muslim women, covering the hair and neck.
A male sibling sharing a single parent, as distinguished from a full brother or brother-german, from a step-brother, or from a brother-like figure such as a blood brother.
Aloneness; state of being alone or solitary, by oneself.
A lonely or deserted place.
A book containing a collection of hymns.
A sealed box with a slit, into which a voter puts a completed voting slip.
The process or method of voting.
definitions.example: The people will decide at the ballot box.

definitions.definition: A postgame show
Following a game, usually specifically a sporting match
definitions.example: Stay tuned for the postgame show.

definitions.definition: A person who owns, plays or practices with the saxophone.
A food of frozen fruit juice with a dairy product such as milk added; a sorbet with dairy ingredients.
An effervescent powder made of bicarbonate of soda, sugar and flavourings, intended to be eaten alone or mixed with water to make a drink.
A traditional West and South Asian sweet drink prepared from fruits or flower petals.
An alcoholic drink, especially beer.
A permanent.
A permanent wave.
To give hair a perm, using heat, chemicals etc.
A permutation.
A combination of outcomes (not a permutation) that a gambler bets on in the football pools.
A female anchorperson.
A fortified place; a large and permanent fortification, sometimes including a town; for example a fort, a castle; a stronghold; a place of defense or security.
A position that, if obtained by the weaker side, will prevent penetration by the opposing side, generally achieving a draw.
To furnish with a fortress or with fortresses; to guard, to fortify.
Having scars or other damage received in battle
A market situation in which two companies exclusively provide a particular product or service.
(by extension) The domination of a field of endeavor by two people or entities.
(by extension) Situation in which two or more TV or radio-stations in the same city or community share common ownership.
To sparkle with light; to shine with a brilliant and broken light or showy luster; to gleam.
definitions.example: a glittering sword

definitions.definition: To be showy, specious, or striking, and hence attractive.
definitions.example: the glittering scenes of a court

definitions.definition: The appearance of something that glitters.
Brightly sparkling.
Valuable, desirable.
A pen or enclosure for swine.
A messy, dirty or debauched place.
To place in, or as if in, a sty
To live in a sty, or any messy or dirty place
A ladder.
To ascend, rise up, climb.
An inflammation of the eyelid.
A person whose job is to publicize information or events; a publicity agent; a public relations agent or worker
A journalist, often a commentator, who focusses on politics
A scholar, of public or international law.
To tear apart by force; to rend; to split; to cleave.
To pierce or cleave with a weapon.
Torn apart.
Broken into pieces; split asunder.
A reliable person or thing.
Able, or easily able to be depended on.
definitions.example: He was a very dependable person.

definitions.definition: A noisy crackling sound; the sound usually associated with crunching.
A critical moment or event.
A problem that leads to a crisis.
(exercise) A form of abdominal exercise, based on a sit-up but in which the lower back remains in contact with the floor.
The overtime work required to catch up and finish a project, usually in the final weeks of development before release.
A dessert consisting of a crunchy topping with fruit underneath.
(generally in the plural) A small piece created by crushing; a piece of material with a friable or crunchy texture.
To crush something, especially food, with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: When I came home, Susan was watching TV with her feet up on the couch, crunching a piece of celery.

definitions.definition: To be crushed with a noisy crackling sound.
definitions.example: Beetles crunched beneath the men's heavy boots as they worked.

definitions.definition: To calculate or otherwise process (e.g. to crunch numbers: to perform mathematical calculations). Presumably from the sound made by mechanical calculators.
definitions.example: That metadata makes it much easier for the search engine to crunch the data for queries.

definitions.definition: To grind or press with violence and noise.
To emit a grinding or crunching noise.
To compress (data) using a particular algorithm, so that it can be restored by decrunching.
To make employees work overtime in order to meet a deadline in the development of a project.
The stem or main axis of a plant, which supports the seed-carrying parts.
definitions.example: a stalk of wheat, rye, or oats;  the stalks of maize or hemp

definitions.definition: The petiole, pedicel, or peduncle of a plant.
Something resembling the stalk of a plant, such as the stem of a quill.
An ornament in the Corinthian capital resembling the stalk of a plant, from which the volutes and helices spring.
One of the two upright pieces of a ladder.
A stem or peduncle, as in certain barnacles and crinoids.
The narrow basal portion of the abdomen of a hymenopterous insect.
The peduncle of the eyes of decapod crustaceans.
An iron bar with projections inserted in a core to strengthen it; a core arbor.
A particular episode of trying to follow or contact someone.
The hunting of a wild animal by stealthy approach.
To approach slowly and quietly in order not to be discovered when getting closer.
To (try to) follow or contact someone constantly, often resulting in harassment.Wp
definitions.example: My ex-girlfriend is stalking me.

definitions.definition: To walk slowly and cautiously; to walk in a stealthy, noiseless manner.
To walk behind something, such as a screen, for the purpose of approaching game; to proceed under cover.
A haughty style of walking.
To walk haughtily.
A sauce made of clarified butter emulsified in egg yolks and white wine vinegar and flavored with herbs.
A large supermarket or similar retail outlet; a superstore.
A course over which races are run.
A racetrack where horse races are run.
A soft mass of material stuffed into a cloth bag, used for comfort or support; for sitting on, kneeling on, resting one's head on etc.
Something acting as a cushion, especially to absorb a shock or impact.

A sufficient quantity of an intangible object (like points or minutes) to allow for some of those points, for example, to be lost without hurting one's chances for successfully completing an objective.
A riotous dance, formerly common at weddings.
To furnish with cushions.
definitions.example: to cushion a sofa

definitions.definition: To seat or place on, or as on a cushion.
To absorb or deaden the impact of.
definitions.example: to cushion a blow

definitions.definition: To conceal or cover up, as under a cushion.
The second lightest chemical element (symbol He) with an atomic number of 2 and atomic weight of 4.002602, a colorless, odorless and inert noble gas.
A form or sample of the element.
A garment that can be pulled on without adjusting fasteners such as buttons or zippers.
Describing a garment that can be pulled on without adjusting fasteners such as buttons or zippers.
One of the South and East Asian birds of the starling family Sturnidae.

A police force operating in secrecy and outside the normal boundaries of law and hidden from the public, usually in support of a totalitarian government's political policies to suppress political dissent through the use of methods including intimidation, violence, and surveillance.
A person or object that carries someone or something else.
definitions.example: aircraft carrier

definitions.definition: A carrier pigeon.
A person or company in the business of shipping freight.
A signal such as radio, sound, or light that is modulated to transmit information.
A mobile network operator; wireless carrier.
A certified airline.
That which drives or carries.
A catalyst or other intermediary in a chemical reaction.
A person or other organism that has a genetic trait, mutation or infection liable to cause a disease, but displays no symptoms.
Charge carrier
A liquid or gas used as a medium for another substance.
definitions.example: inert carrier gas, which transports a chemical reactant

definitions.definition: The seed of the rape plant, Brassica napus, used widely for animal feed and vegetable oil.
The rape plant itself.
A house, enclosure, large cage, or other place for keeping birds confined; a birdhouse.
A kitchen utensil used primarily to measure the volume of liquid or bulk solid cooking ingredients.
A nurse.
To feed and cause to grow; to supply with matter which increases bulk or supplies waste, and promotes health; to furnish with nutriment.
To support; to maintain.
To supply the means of support and increase to; to encourage; to foster
definitions.example: to nourish rebellion

definitions.definition: To cherish; to comfort.
To educate; to instruct; to bring up; to nurture; to promote the growth of in attainments.
To promote growth; to furnish nutriment.
To gain nourishment.
A young male horse.
A young crane (bird).
A youthful or inexperienced person; a novice.
A short piece of rope once used by petty officers as an instrument of punishment.
A young camel or donkey.
To horse; to get with young.
To befool.
To frisk or frolic like a colt; to act licentiously or wantonly.
The act of watching something again.
definitions.example: It's not the best film I've ever seen, but it probably deserves a rewatch.

definitions.definition: To watch again.
A usually scented hairstyling product in aerosol form that stiffens the hair, so it stays in a certain hairstyle.
A young fox.
(by extension) The young of certain other animals, including the bear, wolf, lion and tiger.
A child, especially an awkward, rude, ill-mannered boy.
A young man who seeks relationships with older women, or "cougars".
A stall for cattle.
A cupboard.
To give birth to cubs
To hunt fox cubs
To shut up or confine.
A young, inexperienced reporter employed by a newspaper or magazine.

A person who is unsophisticated or of a lower class background but achieving a high salary, who spends money on flashy or trashy items to fulfil their aspirations of higher social status. The stereotype includes having speech and mannerisms that are considered to denote poor education and uncultured upbringing, which is reflected in their bad taste possessions and lifestyles.
A building that is rented to multiple tenants, especially a low-rent, run-down one.
Any form of property that is held by one person from another, rather than being owned.
definitions.example: The island of Brecqhou is a tenement of Sark.

definitions.definition: Dwelling; abode; habitation.
A very realistic style in art in which a painting or drawing is virtually indistinguishable from a photograph.
Any small model of a person or animal able to be moved by strings or rods, or in the form of a glove.
A person, country, etc, controlled by another.
A poppet; a small image in the human form; a doll.
The upright support for the bearing of the spindle in a lathe.
A puppet made from a sock placed over a hand.
An alternative pseudonymous online account, especially one used for abuse.
Phencyclidine, a type of dissociative anesthetic.
Clenbuterol, a banned growth hormone formerly used in animal feedlots.
The 15th letter of Classical and Modern Greek, and the 16th in Ancient and Old Greek.
A narrow, relatively long rectangular shape.
A gem cut in such a shape.
A variety of bread that is long and narrow in shape.
A small molding, like the astragal, but smaller; a bead.
One of the minute bodies seen in the divided nucleoli of some Infusoria after conjugation.
(mildly offensive) A French person, or a person of French descent.
A consequence or ensuing result of some action.
definitions.example: You realize this little stunt of yours is going to have some pretty serious repercussions.

definitions.definition: The act of driving back, or the state of being driven back; reflection; reverberation.
definitions.example: the repercussion of sound

definitions.definition: Rapid reiteration of the same sound.
The subsidence of a tumour or eruption by the action of a repellent.
In a vaginal examination, the act of imparting through the uterine wall with the finger a shock to the foetus, so that it bounds upward, and falls back again against the examining finger.
A system in broadcasting and recording studios that enables the director to communicate with others during performance.
(by extension) Communication from members of the public to the makers of a broadcast transmission while it is happening.
An assemblage or collage using two or more different materials
Having no variations in height.
definitions.example: The land around here is flat.

definitions.definition: (voice) Without variations in pitch.
Having small or invisible breasts and/or buttocks.
definitions.example: That girl is completely flat on both sides.

definitions.definition: (note) Lowered by one semitone.
Of a note or voice, lower in pitch than it should be.
definitions.example: Your A string is too flat.

definitions.definition: (of a tire or other inflated object) Deflated, especially because of a puncture.
Uninteresting.
definitions.example: The party was a bit flat.

definitions.definition: (of a carbonated drink) With all or most of its carbon dioxide having come out of solution so that the drink no longer fizzes or contains any bubbles.
Lacking acidity without being sweet.
(of a battery) Unable to emit power; dead.
(of a throw) Without spin; spinless.
Lacking liveliness or action; depressed; dull and boring.
definitions.example: The dialogue in your screenplay is flat -- you need to make it more exciting.

definitions.definition: Absolute; downright; peremptory.
definitions.example: His claim was in flat contradiction to experimental results.

definitions.definition: (of a consonant) sonant; vocal, as distinguished from a sharp (non-sonant) consonant

(grammar) Not having an inflectional ending or sign, such as a noun used as an adjective, or an adjective as an adverb, without the addition of a formative suffix; or an infinitive without the sign "to".
definitions.example: Many flat adverbs, as in 'run fast', 'buy cheap', etc. are from Old English.

definitions.definition: (of a golf club) Having a head at a very obtuse angle to the shaft.
(of certain fruits) Flattening at the ends.
(authorship, especially of a character) Lacking in depth, substance, or believability; underdeveloped; one-dimensional.
definitions.example: The author added a chapter to flesh out the books' flatter characters.

definitions.definition: Fixed; unvarying.
definitions.example: a flat fare on public transport

definitions.definition: To compliment someone, often insincerely and sometimes to win favour.
To enhance someone's vanity by praising them.
To portray someone to advantage.
definitions.example: Her portrait flatters her.

definitions.definition: To encourage or cheer someone with (usually false) hope.
A type of set tool used by blacksmiths.
A flat-faced fulling hammer.
A drawplate with a narrow, rectangular orifice, for drawing flat strips such as watch springs.
Someone who flattens, purposely or accidently. Also flattener.
Someone who lives in a rented flat.
Pertaining to charity.
Kind, generous.
Having a purpose or character of a charity.
Resembling milk in color, consistency, smell, etc.; consisting of milk.
(color science) Of the black in an image, appearing as dark gray rather than black.
(of a drink) Containing (an especially large amount of) milk.
definitions.example: milky tea; milky cocoa

definitions.definition: (of grains) Containing a whitish liquid, juicy.
Cowardly.
Immature, childish.
Producing milk, lactating.
A thin metal or wooden rod on which meat is skewered for cooking, often over a fire.
A generally low, narrow, pointed, usually sandy peninsula.
To impale on a spit; to pierce with a sharp object.
definitions.example: to spit a loin of veal

definitions.definition: To use a spit to cook; to attend to food that is cooking on a spit.
definitions.example: She’s spitting the roast in the kitchen.

definitions.definition: A sudden impact or blow.
The shock and noise produced by violently closing a door or other object.
A slam dunk.
An insult.
definitions.example: I don't mean this as a slam, but you can be really impatient sometimes.

definitions.definition: The yellow iron silicate produced in alum works as a waste product.
A poetry slam.
A slambook.
The refuse of alum works.
A subgenre of death metal with elements of hardcore punk focusing on midtempo rhythms, breakdowns and palm-muted riffs
A type of card game, also called ruff and honours.
A card game, played all at once without separate turns, in which players attempt to get rid of their cards as quickly as possible according to certain rules.
Losing or winning all the tricks in a game.
A bid of six (small slam) or seven (grand slam) in a suit or no trump.
Winning all (or all but one) of the available, major or specified events in a given year or sports season.
A shambling fellow.
Saliva, especially when expectorated.
definitions.example: There was spit all over the washbasin.

definitions.definition: An instance of spitting; specifically, a light fall of rain or snow.
A person who exactly resembles someone else (usually in set phrases; see spitting image)
To evacuate (saliva or another substance) from the mouth, etc.
To emit or expel in a manner similar to evacuating saliva from the mouth; specifically, to rain or snow slightly.
definitions.example: a hot pan spitting droplets of fat

definitions.definition: To utter (something) violently.
(hip-hop) To rap, to utter.
To make a spitting sound, like an angry cat.
The depth to which the blade of a spade goes into the soil when it is used for digging; a layer of soil of the depth of a spade's blade.
The amount of soil that a spade holds; a spadeful.
To dig (something) using a spade; also, to turn (the soil) using a plough.
To plant (something) using a spade.
To dig, to spade.
(usually affectionate) a grandmother
A grandfather
The Eriobotrya japonica tree.
The fruit of this tree. It is as large as a small plum, but grows in clusters, and contains four or five large seeds.
To cause to be consumed by fire.
definitions.example: He burned his manuscript in the fireplace.

definitions.definition: To be consumed by fire, or in flames.
definitions.example: He watched the house burn.

definitions.definition: To overheat so as to make unusable.
definitions.example: He burned the toast. The blacksmith burned the steel.

definitions.definition: To become overheated to the point of being unusable.
definitions.example: The grill was too hot and the steak burned.

definitions.definition: To make or produce by the application of fire or burning heat.
definitions.example: to burn a hole;  to burn letters into a block

definitions.definition: To injure (a person or animal) with heat or chemicals that produce similar damage.
definitions.example: She burned the child with an iron, and was jailed for ten years.

definitions.definition: To cauterize.
To sunburn.
definitions.example: She forgot to put on sunscreen and burned.

definitions.definition: To consume, injure, or change the condition of, as if by action of fire or heat; to affect as fire or heat does.
definitions.example: to burn the mouth with pepper

definitions.definition: To be hot, e.g. due to embarrassment.
definitions.example: The child's forehead was burning with fever.  Her cheeks burned with shame.

definitions.definition: To cause to combine with oxygen or other active agent, with evolution of heat; to consume; to oxidize.
definitions.example: A human being burns a certain amount of carbon at each respiration.  to burn iron in oxygen

definitions.definition: To combine energetically, with evolution of heat.
definitions.example: Copper burns in chlorine.

definitions.definition: To write data to a permanent storage medium like a compact disc or a ROM chip.
definitions.example: We’ll burn this program onto an EEPROM one hour before the demo begins.

definitions.definition: To betray.
definitions.example: The informant burned him.

definitions.definition: To insult or defeat.
definitions.example: I just burned you again.

definitions.definition: To waste (time); to waste money or other resources.
definitions.example: The company has burned more than a million dollars a month this year.

definitions.definition: In certain games, to approach near to a concealed object which is sought.
definitions.example: You're cold... warm... hot... you're burning!

definitions.definition: To accidentally touch a moving stone.
In pontoon, to swap a pair of cards for another pair, or to deal a dead card.
To increase the exposure for certain areas of a print in order to make them lighter (compare dodge).
(of an element) To be converted to another element in a nuclear fusion reaction, especially in a star
To discard.
To shoot someone with a firearm.
Damaged or injured by fire or heat.
(of food) Carbonised.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Having a sunburn.

A pale blue color.
Of a pale blue color.

To deny the truth of something.
A document filed by a pilot prior to departure, containing essential information about the flight.
A buttress that stands apart from the structure that it supports, and is connected to it by an arch (flyer).
Joy; happiness great delight, especially from one's own good fortune or from another's misfortune.
Music; minstrelsy; entertainment.
An unaccompanied part song for three or more solo voices, not necessarily merry.
To sing a glee (unaccompanied part song).
A perjured person.
To knowingly and willfully make a false statement of witness while in court.

Of or concerning the devil; satanic.

A loop of cloth, worn around the neck, for supporting a baby or other such load.

A strap attached to a firearm, for suspending it from the shoulder.

To pass a rope around (a cask, gun, etc.) preparatory to attaching a hoisting or lowering tackle.
To sell, peddle, or distribute illicitly (e.g. drugs, sex, etc.).
A young or infant spider, such as one raised in captivity.
The return of a situation to a previous position or state.

A product recall because of a defect or safety concern.

A follow-up audition (casting)

Any bird that spends most of its time in coastal waters or over the oceans.
An addition.

A lightweight, free-flying, foot-launched glider aircraft with no rigid primary structure, wherein the pilot sits in a harness suspended below a hollow fabric wing whose shape is formed by its suspension lines, the pressure of air entering vents in the front of the wing and the aerodynamic forces of the air flowing over the outside.
